item.title: Proto-Morellic
item.description: Proto-Morellic Proto-Morellic: /s̠äˈbʱä.z̠ɛç̠/ was spoken in 7,000YA, by the Cervina-Rohitan peoples. Phonology Syllable Structure (C)(S)V(V)(C) Features Penultimate Stress Consonants Consonants Labial Alveolar Post Alveolar Palatal* Velar Nasal m n ŋ Plosive p b t d c̠ ɟ̠ k g Plosive (breathy) bʱ dʱ ɟ̠ʱ gʱ Fricative f v s̠ z̠ ʃ ʒ ç̠ x ɣ Sonorant l r j w Palatal consonants are allophones of velars in coda position.

item.title: Proto-Snixian
item.description: Proto-Snixian Proto-Snixian: /t͡ʃé:sòn épā:ɫìç/ was spoken 8,500 years before the present, by the Proto-Snixian peoples. Phonology Syllable Structure (C)V(C) Features Penultimate Stress

item.title: Sarvaran
item.description: Sarvaran Sarvaran: /sɑˈʋɑ́.ɾa/ was spoken in 6,500YA, by the Sarvaran Civilisation. It descended from Proto-Morellic and so is part of the Morellic Language Family.

item.title: Sarvaran Poetry
item.description: Prosody Poetry in Sarvaran commonly follows a Quantitative-Accentual-Syllabic structure, being grouped into segments of 6 syllables. [Long Vowel -Stress A]

item.title: Stonechild Imperial
item.description: Stonechild Imperial was spoken in the Empire of the Petrified Child. It descended from Sarvaran and so is part of the Morellic Language Family.
